code.value:
from pathlib import Path

from langflow.base.data.utils import TEXT_FILE_TYPES, parse_text_file_to_data
from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.io import BoolInput, FileInput, Output
from langflow.schema import Data


class FileComponent(Component):
    display_name = "File"
    description = "A generic file loader."
    icon = "file-text"
    name = "File"

    inputs = [
        FileInput(
            name="path",
            display_name="Path",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES,
            info=f"Supported file types: {', '.join(TEXT_FILE_TYPES)}",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="silent_errors",
            display_name="Silent Errors",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, errors will not raise an exception.",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Data", name="data", method="load_file"),
    ]

    def load_file(self) -> Data:
        if not self.path:
            msg = "Please, upload a file to use this component."
            raise ValueError(msg)
        resolved_path = self.resolve_path(self.path)
        silent_errors = self.silent_errors

        extension = Path(resolved_path).suffix[1:].lower()

        if extension == "doc":
            msg = "doc files are not supported. Please save as .docx"
            raise ValueError(msg)
        if extension not in TEXT_FILE_TYPES:
            msg = f"Unsupported file type: {extension}"
            raise ValueError(msg)

        data = parse_text_file_to_data(resolved_path, silent_errors)
        self.status = data or "No data"
        return data or Data()
code.name: code

silent_errors.info: If true, errors will not raise an exception.

code.value:
from langchain_text_splitters import CharacterTextSplitter

from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.io import HandleInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from langflow.schema import Data
from langflow.utils.util import unescape_string


class SplitTextComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Split Text"
    description: str = "Split text into chunks based on specified criteria."
    icon = "scissors-line-dashed"
    name = "SplitText"

    inputs = [
        HandleInput(
            name="data_inputs",
            display_name="Data Inputs",
            info="The data to split.",
            input_types=["Data"],
            is_list=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="chunk_overlap",
            display_name="Chunk Overlap",
            info="Number of characters to overlap between chunks.",
            value=200,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="chunk_size",
            display_name="Chunk Size",
            info="The maximum number of characters in each chunk.",
            value=1000,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="separator",
            display_name="Separator",
            info="The character to split on. Defaults to newline.",
            value="\n",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Chunks", name="chunks", method="split_text"),
    ]

    def _docs_to_data(self, docs):
        return [Data(text=doc.page_content, data=doc.metadata) for doc in docs]

    def split_text(self) -> list[Data]:
        separator = unescape_string(self.separator)

        documents = [_input.to_lc_document() for _input in self.data_inputs if isinstance(_input, Data)]

        splitter = CharacterTextSplitter(
            chunk_overlap=self.chunk_overlap,
            chunk_size=self.chunk_size,
            separator=separator,
        )
        docs = splitter.split_documents(documents)
        data = self._docs_to_data(docs)
        self.status = data
        return data
code.name: code

separator.name: separator
separator.info: The character to split on. Defaults to newline.

code.value:
from langflow.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from langflow.io import Output, PromptInput
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)
code.name: code

# LLM Prompt: Generate Detailed Podcast Script

Using the provided data: {data}, create a comprehensive podcast script featuring {number_of_speakers} speakers, Person A, Person B, ..., with a total duration of {PodcastDuration}. 
In this script you must separate the themes in a really amazing way, knowing that these parts will be recorded separatedly so they must include a good deep of details.

from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.helpers.data import data_to_text
from langflow.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput
from langflow.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"
    description = "Convert Data into plain text following a specified template."
    icon = "braces"
    name = "ParseData"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. "
            "It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)
code.name: code

from langflow.base.io.text import TextComponent
from langflow.io import MultilineInput, Output
from langflow.schema.message import Message


class TextInputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Input"
    description = "Get text inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as input.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        return message

import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from langflow.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from langflow.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from langflow.field_typing import LanguageModel
from langflow.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langflow.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)
from langflow.inputs.inputs import HandleInput


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = [
        *LCModelComponent._base_inputs,
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. "
            "You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. "
            "If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. "
            "Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. "
            "You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
        HandleInput(
            name="output_parser",
            display_name="Output Parser",
            info="The parser to use to parse the output of the model",
            advanced=True,
            input_types=["OutputParser"],
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key) if openai_api_key else None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})

        return output

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return None
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")
            if message:
                return message
        return None
code.name: code

json_mode.info: If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.

code.value:
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.io import Output, DataInput, SecretStrInput
from openai import OpenAI
import os
from langflow.schema import Data
from pydub import AudioSegment
import tempfile

class MultiSpeakerAudioGenerator(Component):
    display_name = "OpenAI Whisper Data to Speech"
    description = "Generates a single speech audio file from dialogue data with multiple speakers using OpenAI's TTS API."
    documentation: str = "https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text-to-speech"
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "MultiSpeakerAudioGenerator"
    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="input_value", display_name="Data Input Dialogue", info="The Input Data here should have the keys Speaker, Dialogue and Duration (in seconds). Here is an example: \nSpeaker, Dialogue, Duration\nPerson A, Some Dialogue Here , 20\nPerson B, Some Other Here , 10"),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="filepath",
            display_name="File Path to Save",
            info="File Path to save audio result (Do NOT include file extension), it will always be saved as mp3.",
            advanced=False,
            value="audio_result"
        )
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Generated Audio Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Data:
        """
        Generates a single speech audio file from dialogue data with multiple speakers using OpenAI's TTS API.
        """
        # Validate the API key
        if not self.api_key:
            raise ValueError("OpenAI API key must be provided.")
        
        client = OpenAI(api_key=self.api_key)
        
        if not client.api_key:
            raise ValueError("Invalid OpenAI API key set in environment variable 'OPENAI_API_KEY'.")

        # Initialize empty audio segment
        combined_audio = AudioSegment.silent(duration=0)
        output_info = []
        available_voices = ['alloy', 'nova', 'echo', 'fable', 'onyx', 'shimmer']
        speaker_voice_map = {}
        voice_index = 0

        # Create a temporary directory to store intermediate audio files
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            for idx, data_item in enumerate(self.input_value):
                # Extract speaker and dialogue information
                try:
                    speaker = data_item.data['Speaker']
                    dialogue = data_item.data['Dialogue']
                except KeyError as e:
                    raise ValueError(f"Missing required data field: {str(e)}")
                
                # Assign a voice to each speaker sequentially
                if speaker not in speaker_voice_map:
                    speaker_voice_map[speaker] = available_voices[voice_index % len(available_voices)]
                    voice_index += 1
                
                voice = speaker_voice_map[speaker]

                # Generate speech audio
                try:
                    response = client.audio.speech.create(
                        model="tts-1",
                        voice=voice,
                        input=dialogue
                    )
                except Exception as e:
                    raise RuntimeError(f"An error occurred while generating speech for {speaker}: {e}")
                
                # Save the generated audio to a temporary file
                temp_audio_file = os.path.join(temp_dir, f"temp_{idx}.mp3")
                response.stream_to_file(temp_audio_file)

                # Append the generated audio to the combined audio segment
                try:
                    audio_segment = AudioSegment.from_mp3(temp_audio_file)
                    combined_audio += audio_segment
                except Exception as e:
                    raise RuntimeError(f"An error occurred while processing the audio file for {speaker}: {e}")
                
                # Add speaker dialogue info to output
                output_info.append({
                    'speaker': speaker,
                    'dialogue': dialogue,
                    'voice': voice
                })

        # Export the final combined audio file
        final_audio_file = f"{self.filepath}.mp3"
        try:
            combined_audio.export(final_audio_file, format="mp3")
        except Exception as e:
            raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to export combined audio file: {e}")

        # Return the data output
        return Data(
            name="output",
            data={
                'audio_file': final_audio_file,
                'dialogue_info': output_info
            },
            text_key="audio_file"
        )
code.name: code

filepath.name: filepath
filepath.info: File Path to save audio result (Do NOT include file extension), it will always be saved as mp3.

node.description: Generates a single speech audio file from dialogue data with multiple speakers using OpenAI's TTS API.

input_value.name: input_value
input_value.value:
1. Begin with a brief introduction and end with a conclusion.
2. Maintain a natural conversation flow between Person A and Person B.
3. Include pauses, interruptions, and overlapping speech where appropriate.
4. Vary the length of each dialogue segment (5-30 seconds) for a more dynamic conversation.
5. Incorporate relevant sound effects or background noises to enhance the audio experience.
6. Use a diverse range of tones and emotions to bring the conversation to life.
7. Ensure the content is engaging, informative, and tailored to the topic.
8. Include timestamps for each dialogue segment, ensuring the total duration matches.

input_value.value:
- Be specific in describing tones (e.g., sarcastic, curious, professional) and emotions (e.g., surprised, amused, concerned).
- Include non-verbal cues in the dialogue when relevant (e.g., "[laughs]", "[sighs]").
- For sound effects, be precise (e.g., "Phone ringing", "Door creaking", "Applause").
- Ensure the content is coherent, factual, and aligns with the provided data.
- If the data includes technical terms or complex concepts, incorporate brief explanations or analogies to make the content accessible to a general audience.

Please generate a detailed, engaging, and realistic podcast script based on these guidelines.

# from langflow.field_typing import Data
from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from langflow.schema import Data


import importlib
import subprocess
import sys
from typing import Dict, Any, List
from pydantic import BaseModel
import logging
import json

from langchain.chains import LLMChain
from langchain.prompts import PromptTemplate, ChatPromptTemplate
from langflow.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent
from langflow.inputs.inputs import HandleInput, IntInput
from langflow.schema.message import Message

from langchain_community.chat_models import ChatOpenAI
from langchain_core.output_parsers import StrOutputParser
from langchain_core.prompts import ChatPromptTemplate
from langchain_core.pydantic_v1 import BaseModel
from langchain_core.runnables import RunnablePassthrough
from langflow.schema import Data
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.io import MessageTextInput, Output

class SkeletonChain(Component):
    display_name = "Skeleton of Thoughts Chain"
    description = "A component that implements Skeleton Thought Chain (Chain Planning)"
    documentation: str = "https://python.langchain.com/v0.1/docs/templates/skeleton-of-thought/"
    icon = "LangChain"
    name = "skeleton-of-thought"

    inputs = [
        HandleInput(
            name="llm",
            display_name="Language Model",
            input_types=["LanguageModel"],
            required=True,
            info="An LLM Executable Object."
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input",
            display_name="Input",
            value="Hello, World!",
            info="The question or topic you want to explore using the Skeleton of Thoughts method."
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="number_of_topics",
            display_name="Number of Topics",
            value=5,
            info="The number of main points in the skeleton. It works better choicing a range between 1 and 20."
        ),
    ]
    
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output",name="output",method="build_thoughts_data"),
    ]
    
    class ChainInput(BaseModel):
        question: str

    @staticmethod
    def parse_numbered_list(input_str: str) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
        """
        Parses a numbered list into a list of dictionaries.

        Each element having two keys:
        'point_index' for the index in the numbered list, and 'point_skeleton' for the content.
        """
        lines = input_str.strip().split("\n")
        parsed_list = []
    
        for line in lines:
            parts = line.split(". ", 1)
            if len(parts) == 2:
                try:
                    index = int(parts[0])
                    point = parts[1].strip()
                    parsed_list.append({"point_index": index, "point_skeleton": point})
                except ValueError:
                    continue  # Skip lines that don't start with a valid number
    
        return parsed_list

    @staticmethod
    def create_list_elements(_input: Dict[str, Any]) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
        """
        Creates a list of elements from the input skeleton and question.
        """
        skeleton = _input["skeleton"]
        numbered_list = SkeletonChain.parse_numbered_list(skeleton)
        return [{"skeleton": skeleton, "question": _input["question"], **el} for el in numbered_list]

    @staticmethod
    def get_final_answer(expanded_list: List[str]) -> Dict[str, Dict[str, str]]:
        """
        Constructs a dictionary of answers from an expanded list.
        Each entry includes a title and description.
        """
        return {
            f"point_{i+1}": {
                "point_title": " ".join(el.split()[:3]),
                "point_description": el
            }
            for i, el in enumerate(expanded_list)
        }
    

    def build_thoughts_data(self) -> Data:
        """
        Builds the output for the component.
        """
        logger.info("Starting build_output...")
        if self.number_of_topics <= 0:
            raise ValueError("The Number of Points should be a Positive Value!")

        # Refined Prompt Template to enforce JSON format
        skeleton_generator_template = f"""You're an organizer responsible for only \
        giving the skeleton (not the full content) for answering the question.
        Provide the skeleton as a numbered list of points to answer \
        the question. Each skeleton point should be very short \
        with only 35 words. \
        The skeleton must have {self.number_of_topics} points. Now, please provide the skeleton \
        for the following question.
        {{question}}
        Skeleton:"""

        skeleton_generator_prompt = ChatPromptTemplate.from_template(
            skeleton_generator_template
        )
        
        logger.debug("Skeleton Generator Prompt Created.")

        skeleton_generator_chain = (
            skeleton_generator_prompt | self.llm | StrOutputParser()
        )

        logger.debug("Skeleton Generator Chain Created.")

        # Updated Point Expander Template for clarity
        point_expander_template = """You're responsible for continuing \
        the writing of one and only one point in the overall answer to the following question.
        Question: {question}
        The skeleton of the answer is:
        {skeleton}
        Continue and only continue the writing of point {point_index}. \
        Write it **very shortly** in 12 sentences and do not continue with other points!
        Point {point_index}. {point_skeleton}"""

        point_expander_prompt = ChatPromptTemplate.from_template(point_expander_template)
        
        logger.debug("Point Expander Prompt Created.")

        point_expander_chain = RunnablePassthrough.assign(
            continuation=point_expander_prompt | self.llm | StrOutputParser()
        ) | (lambda x: x["point_skeleton"].strip() + " " + x["continuation"])
        
        logger.debug("Point Expander Chain Created.")

        # Define the entire chain
        chain = (
            RunnablePassthrough.assign(skeleton=skeleton_generator_chain)
            | self.create_list_elements
            | point_expander_chain.map()
            | self.get_final_answer
        ).with_types(input_type=self.ChainInput)
        
        logger.debug("Chain Defined.")

        # Invoke the chain with the input question
        chain_output = chain.invoke({"question": self.input})
        
        logger.debug(f"Chain Output: {chain_output}")

        # Extract the final answer
        try:
            model_output = json.dumps(chain_output, indent=2)
            logger.debug(f"Model Output (JSON): {model_output}")
        except (TypeError, ValueError) as e:
            logger.error(f"Error converting chain_output to JSON string: {e}")
            model_output = str(chain_output)  # Fallback to string representation

        # Ensure that page_content is a string
        if not isinstance(model_output, str):
            logger.error("model_output is not a string. Converting to string.")
            model_output = str(model_output)
        
        converted_output = [{"result": i} for i in range(1, len(model_output) + 1)]
        
        parsed_output = json.loads(model_output)
    
        # Convert to the desired format
        converted_output = [{
        f"point_{i}": parsed_output[f"point_{i}"]["point_description"]
        for i in range(1, len(parsed_output) + 1)
        }]
        
        return Data(data=converted_output[0])

code.value:
from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.helpers.data import data_to_text
from langflow.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput
from langflow.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"
    description = "Convert Data into plain text following a specified template."
    icon = "braces"
    name = "ParseData"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. "
            "It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)

from langflow.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from langflow.io import Output, PromptInput
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)

Using the provided data: {data}, create a comprehensive podcast script featuring {number_of_speakers} speakers, Person A, Person B, ..., with a total duration of {PodcastDuration}. The output should be in CSV format with the following columns: Speaker, Dialogue and Duration (in seconds).

## Instructions:

You are responsible to create the first part (OPENING) of the Podcast (with opening) with the theme of {theme}.
Try creating this first part with 5 minutes.

## Output Format:

{output_format}

## Additional Notes:

{additional_details}

from langflow.base.io.text import TextComponent
from langflow.io import MultilineInput, Output
from langflow.schema.message import Message


class TextOutputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Output"
    description = "Display a text output in the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextOutput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as output.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        self.status = self.input_value
        return message

code.value:
import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from langflow.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from langflow.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from langflow.field_typing import LanguageModel
from langflow.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langflow.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)
from langflow.inputs.inputs import HandleInput


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = [
        *LCModelComponent._base_inputs,
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. "
            "You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. "
            "If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. "
            "Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. "
            "You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
        HandleInput(
            name="output_parser",
            display_name="Output Parser",
            info="The parser to use to parse the output of the model",
            advanced=True,
            input_types=["OutputParser"],
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key) if openai_api_key else None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})

        return output

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return None
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")
            if message:
                return message
        return None
code.name: code

json_mode.name: json_mode
json_mode.info: If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.

max_tokens.name: max_tokens
max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.

openai_api_base.name: openai_api_base
openai_api_base.info: The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.

output_schema.name: output_schema
output_schema.info: The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.

seed.name: seed
seed.info: The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.

stream.name: stream
stream.info: Stream the response from the model. Streaming works only in Chat.

system_message.name: system_message
system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.

import operator
from functools import reduce

from langflow.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from langflow.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from langflow.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from langflow.field_typing import LanguageModel
from langflow.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

code.value:
from langflow.base.io.text import TextComponent
from langflow.io import MultilineInput, Output
from langflow.schema.message import Message


class TextOutputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Output"
    description = "Display a text output in the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextOutput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as output.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        self.status = self.input_value
        return message

import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from langflow.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from langflow.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from langflow.field_typing import LanguageModel
from langflow.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langflow.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)
from langflow.inputs.inputs import HandleInput


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = [
        *LCModelComponent._base_inputs,
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. "
            "You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. "
            "If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. "
            "Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. "
            "You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
        HandleInput(
            name="output_parser",
            display_name="Output Parser",
            info="The parser to use to parse the output of the model",
            advanced=True,
            input_types=["OutputParser"],
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key) if openai_api_key else None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})

        return output

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return None
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")
            if message:
                return message
        return None
